shortdesc.ph: Switches between front and rear cameras.
Switches between front and rear cameras.

section.p: You can call this method to dynamically switch between the front and rear cameras based on the available cameras during app runtime, without restarting the video stream or reconfiguring the video source.

You can call this method during runtime to dynamically switch between front and rear cameras based on the available cameras, without restarting the video stream or reconfiguring the video source. This method and switchCamera(String cameraId) can both be used to switch cameras. The difference is that switchCamera(String cameraId) switches to a specific camera by specifying the camera ID, while this method switches the camera direction (front or rear).

ul.li: This method only switches the camera for the video stream captured by the first camera, that is, the video stream whose source is set to VIDEO_SOURCE_CAMERA (0) when calling .
This method is only applicable to Android and iOS platforms.

section.note: This method only switches the camera for the video stream captured by the primary camera, i.e., the video stream whose source is set to VIDEO_SOURCE_CAMERA_PRIMARY (0) when calling .

section.title: Timing
section.p: You must call this method after the camera is successfully enabled, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).
